column4: lonnie: the Live CDs will likely not boot with 64MB ram, 192 or so is the minimum
you may be able to boot/install with the Alternate CD, but I think you will not be happy with Ubuntu performance with that little RAM, without very drastic modification
i have several semi-older pc's that run fine with 128MB
get more RAM; RAM's cheap, the only limit should be what the motherboard supports
